column2: FL DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. The length of a point suspension is 1 year for:
2. Car pool vehicles are:
column4: vehicles with 2 or more occupants in the car.
column6: luxury vehicles with special driving privileges.
column8: not allowed on some interstate roads.
column10: not allowed to pass on a two-lane highway.

column2: 3. Which of the following can be dangerous:
column6: Driving while calling on a mobile phone.

column2: 4. Which of the following is NOT a way to avoid aggressive driving?
column4: Calling the police if you witness something you think is aggressive driving.
column6: Closely tailgating the car in front of you.
column8: Not getting behind the wheel if you are irritable.
column10: Avoid driving when you are feeling tired.

column2: 5. If you are in a crash while driving, you must:
6. The center lane in the picture:
column4: can be used for right turns.
column6: may be used for left turns.

column2: 7. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 8. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit for cars in a residential area is __ miles per hour.
9. The risk of death is __ times greater if you are thrown from a vehicle in a crash.
10. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 11. Controlled substances do NOT include:
12. Before entering a curve, drivers should _____________ and watch for oncoming vehicles.
column6: slow down, move to the right side of the road
column8: move to the left side of the road
column10: turn their head to make sure the blind spots are clear.

column2: 13. What are blind spots?
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see while driving in the fog.
column6: Areas near the rear corners of vehicles that drivers cannot see in their rearview mirrors.
column8: Areas reserved for blind people at crossings.

column2: 14. Parking is NOT allowed:
15. When going down a steep hill, drivers must:
16. If a chain is used as the towing connection between two vehicles, what does the chain need to have displayed on it?
column4: A white flag at least 12 inches square.
column6: A red flasher, visible from 500 feet.
column8: A red flag with a triangular warning sign.

column2: 17. Leaving the scene involving property damage commits a misdemeanor of the _____ degree.
18. The picture shows a _________ sign.
19. Who is more affected by alcohol?
20. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column8: remove the sign and move forward.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 21. A broken yellow line:
column4: separates lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: prohibits vehicles moving in either direction from crossing the line.
column8: separates lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 22. A ____________ marks the right edge of the roadway.
23. Tampering with emissions control devices can cause:
24. A driver must stop __ feet, but not less than __ feet from the nearest rail of a railroad-highway grade crossing, when the the crossing gate is lowered.
25. Are motor vehicles allowed to drive in bike lanes?
column4: No, except at intersections where indicated by broken white lines, and only when no bicyclists are present in the bike lane.
column6: Yes, but only when indicated by broken yellow lines.

column2: 26. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 27. Which of the following is NOT a rule for safe driving:
column4: Don’t drive when you are sleep deprived.
column6: Always wear corrective lenses as required.
column10: Always wear sunglasses in dark conditions.

column2: 28. Cars entering an expressway:
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic on the expressway.
column8: have the right-of-way over other vehicles.

column2: 29. Which of the following is true? Vehicles approaching a railroad-highway grade crossing must:
column4: not stop when the warning devices are flashing,
column8: stop when the crossing gate is lowered.
column10: stop only when an approaching train is clearly visible.

column2: 30. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 31. Drivers entering a roundabout:
column4: must yield to traffic already in the circle.
column6: must follow the vehicle in front of them closely.
column8: must travel in a clockwise direction.
column10: must stop when the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 32. Which shape is a warning sign?
33. You arrive at an intersection with a green traffic signal. Can you drive straight through the intersection?
column4: Yes, as long as you yield to pedestrians and vehicles still in the intersection.
column6: Yes, but only if this is an open/uncontrolled intersection.
column8: Yes, but only if the intersection is not clear.

column2: 34. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 35. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
36. Red reflectors facing you mean that:
column4: you are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: you are approaching a red traffic signal at an intersection.
column8: you need to come to a complete stop.

column2: 37. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column10: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 38. Flashing arrow panels are used:
column8: to indicate that vehicles must not make a right or left turn at the intersection.
column10: where it is necessary to move into another lane.

column2: 39. If a driver doubles the speed of a car, they increases its force of impact:
40. The picture shows:
41. To operate a moped on a public road, you must be __ years of age or older.
42. The Florida Department of Transportation’s Traffic Information Service operates 24 hours a day on the phone by dialing:
43. If you refuse to take a blood test when asked by an officer, your license will automatically be suspended for:
44. If you drink alcohol, you should:
column4: stop if you are feeling drowsy while driving.

column2: 45. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column10: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 46. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 47. Parking is NOT allowed:
48. What is a reversible traffic lane?
column4: A traffic lane where the flow of traffic may change during different times of the day.
column6: A lane reserved for car pool vehicles.
column8: A lane where the flow of traffic may be reversed by traffic signals.
column10: A traffic lane where vehicles are allowed to travel in both directions.

column2: 49. Driving 15 MPH or less over lawful or posted speed will result in __ points being added.
50. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column6: when it is hard to see ahead.
